snippet: A purchase price of $5.8 million with fees for Joan Mitchell’s 1969-70 Abstract Expressionist painting “Afternoon” pushed the total art sales by Christie’s this week past $1 billion.
abstract: Christie's reaches a first in art world, becoming first auction house to sell more than $1 billion worth of art in a week; reports combined totals of auction of postwar and contemporary art of $658.5 million and 20th-century art auction of $705.9 million; milestone is symbolic victory for Christie's over its rival Sotheby's, and is indication of way art has become investment and status symbol worth vying for among world's most affluent people.
lead_paragraph: A purchase price of $5.8 million with fees for Joan Mitchell’s 1969-70 Abstract Expressionist painting “Afternoon” pushed the total art sales by Christie’s this week past $1 billion.

headline.main: Christie’s Has Art World’s First $1 Billion Week
